newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft down on earns.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft down on earns.

text.p: Software giant Microsoft Corp slumped before the markets opened Thursday after it reported earnings just above a Wall Street consensus estimate.
Traders said Microsoft's slide could steepen as the pace of markets picked up. "It's down ... now, but people are just starting to get into the market," one said.
Microsoft traded at 143-3/4, down from a Thursday close of 149-8/16. The shares had fallen to 146 in after-hours trade.

Microsoft reported fourth-quarter earnings after the markets' close Thursday of $0.80 a share. The earnings were $0.01 better than the consensus estimate, but far below the so-called "whisper numbers" for results.
Among other technology stocks, Sun Microsystems Inc was trading at 44-5/8 from a close of 45-9/16. The stock had dipped to as low as 44-3/4 in after-hours trading.
The company reported fourth-quarter earnings per share of $0.61 against $0.31 for the same period a year before.
Semiconductor maker Intel Corp was trading at 85-3/4 from a close of 87-13/16.
ITT Corp was trading at 65-5/8 from a close of 65-9/16 after The Wall Street Journal reported the company might have outmaneuvered a takeover bid from Hilton Hotels Corp.
International Business Machines Corp was trading at 99-1/2 from a close of 99-13/16, and Eastman Kodak Co was trading at 67 from a close of 66-4/16.
